listing.listing_description:
Monte Cala Moli is stunning luxury villa on the southwest coast of Ibiza. Situated within walking distance of the secluded beach of Cala Moli, the villa features breathtaking views of the coastline and sea, along with exquisite alfresco living areas, gorgeous interiors, and five deluxe bedrooms (including four with king beds). Providing serene privacy along with convenient access to Ibiza's famous beaches and nightlife, Monte Cala Moli is an ideal vacation rental for destination wedding guests, families, and groups of friends.

The gated, beautifully landscaped estate features multiple terraces for entertaining guests or luxuriating in the Mediterranean light. Enjoy enchanting days by the large swimming pool, sipping cool drinks on elegant sun loungers. Savor afternoon cocktails in the covered, poolside lounge, or walk up the stairs to the upper terrace and sit in the shade of its lovely canopy. Here, prepare delicious meals in the well-equipped outdoor kitchen, and gather around the alfresco tables for a sea-view feast. Lovely lighting and an outdoor bathroom and shower ensure total comfort, night and day.

An open wall joins the poolside lounge with the interior living room, inviting the lovely views and breeze indoors. The gorgeous dining table, too, enjoys an exquisite alfresco ambiance, while the adjoining kitchen is fully equipped with chef-grade appliances and a superb bar for serving tapas, cocktails, and breakfast. The understated yet gorgeous décor features superb contemporary artwork and design pieces, which enhance the serene luminosity of the home and accentuate Ibiza's natural beauty.

The villa's bedrooms provide sumptuous private settings for afternoon siestas and tranquil nights. The main house includes four bedroom suites—three with king beds, one with a double-size bed—while the guesthouse has a king bedroom. The master suite enjoys a private balcony and ensuite shower room. The guesthouse features a kitchenette, ensuite bathroom, and doors to the terrace.

Monte Cala Moni offers the perfect balance of seclusion and convenience. Just ten minutes on foot from Cala Moli, you're also just a short drive or bicycle ride to Cala Vadella and Cala Tarida. Ibiza town is about twenty kilometers away, and Sant Antoni de Portmany about fifteen. The famous fishing town of Es Cubells is an easy drive to the south.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Located in Rome’s, Centro Storico, this luxuriously outfitted five-bedroom features spacious lounge areas, the latest tech gadgets, and quick access to all of Rome’s most incredible attractions. Perfect for a family getaway, couples retreat, or group vacation, Costaguti has everything you’ll need to make this Luxury Retreat an unforgettable experience. Nearby, you’ll find historic buildings on every corner, privately owned cafes, the finest Italian cuisine, and the vibrant lifestyle of Rome, The Eternal City.

Overlooking Piazza Mattei’s iconic Turtle Fountain, Costaguti’s towering living room windows frame excellent city views and increase the spacious feel within. Features like crown molding, vaulted ceilings, and frescoes walls display the apartment’s thoughtful construction, while Italian works of art, ornate furniture, and modern high-end electronics add to the luxuriously local influence of the decor. If you’re thinking of hosting a dinner party or social gathering, you’ll appreciate the vast lounge areas in the living room, billiards room, and dining area. And, with bedrooms spread across two floors, privacy is never an issue.

Costaguti’s tech features include Wi-Fi, a Bose sound system, and a wide-screen Smart television with Netflix, Spotify, and SkyTV with service in several languages. In the kitchen, you’ll find state of the art appliances, a dishwasher, Nespresso machine, and in the dining room, there is seating for fourteen. The apartment is also adorned with air conditioning, a sauna, washer/dryer, and a grand billiards room, great for entertaining.

Within twenty minutes driving, you’ll be able to visit so many of Rome’s iconic landmarks, like The Colosseum, Roman Forum, Spanish Steps, and The Pantheon. If you’re in the mood for some shopping, Via Condotti is home to some of the finest fashion houses in the city. While you're exploring the streets of the Fashion District, stop at one of the many independent restaurants, cafes, and gelato shops for an afternoon treat. For a casual dinner, visit the nearby pub, Open Baladin for a massive selection of Italian craft beers and an ever-changing menu based on fresh local ingredients.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Located in a private grove on the historical park area of Achilleon Palace, villa Noela enjoys breathtaking views of the Ionian Sea and rows of olive trees. This vast property features two separate villas, two swimming pools, and oceanfront access. With so much versatile hosting space, this villa is perfect for high-end corporate retreats, family reunions, and destination weddings.

Celebrating its gorgeous surroundings, Noela utilizes floor-to-ceiling openings along its ocean-facing walls to invite fresh sea breeze and natural sunlight to fill its interior spaces. Inside, designers have put a trendy spin on traditional Greek architecture by straightening out the villa sightlines and maintaining the classic white-washed color scheme. The kitchens differentiate themselves with elegant, granite countertops and state of the art appliances. Lounge areas are adorned with top of the line electronics and designer furnishings. And, all seven bedrooms have direct access to an outdoor area.

Noela makes it easy to manage your large group with its two fully equipped kitchens, two formal dining areas, and a staff and services package consisting of a daily breakfast buffet, housekeeping, and a private chef. Spacious lounge areas inside and on the terrace make it easy to gather as a group, while spaces like the media room, poolside lounge, and bistro-style sitting areas provide more private settings. Other features include cable television, Wi-Fi, a washer/dryer, and air conditioning.

Eight kilometers from home, the town of Corfu is where you’ll find authentic Greek restaurants, boutique shops, delicious bakeries, vibrant nightlife, and their prestigious golf and yacht clubs. If you feel like traveling a little further, consider a day trip to the summit of Mount Pantokrator, where on particularly clear days, you can see all the way to Italy.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Try out life in a small Tuscan town at 1213 La Residenza. Located in the Piazza San Bernardino of the town of Castelmuzio, the villa is named for the date of the first written mention of the town. The charming three-bedroom home is a palazzo signorile, or gentleman’s house, which is reflected in its elegant interiors, manicured garden and luxurious terrace.

Though intended for noble families of a different era, 1213 La Residenza has plenty of modern comforts to offer today’s guests. Enjoy breakfast on the terrace off the dining room, take a dip in the private plunge pool and while away the afternoon in the sunshine on a chaise longue. Parking is available for both your rental car, at a nearby space. There’s also Wi-Fi and book and movie collections to entertain on quiet evenings in.

The villa’s interiors offer interest at every turn, from wrought-iron railings on the stairs to an antique daybed. Beamed ceilings offer a glimpse of typical Tuscan architecture, while the living room’s red walls show a decidedly contemporary hand. The dining room and kitchen lie just beyond the fireplace; the kitchen is well-stocked with a blender, juicer and separate wine fridge.

1213 La Residenza’s three bedroom suites have en-suite bathrooms and air conditioning. There’s no need to pack shampoo, either, as toiletries are provided. One suite has a king bed, while the other two each have a queen bed and a daybed for reading or catnaps. All of the bedrooms are furnished with a mix of traditional pieces, exotic finds, and brightly colored walls and fabrics.

The villa is just steps from a church and restaurant in Castelmuzio, and a 3-minute walk from the nearest grocery store. Hop in the car for the 12-minute drive to the gym, or the 15-minute drive to a tennis court, the Esse golf club or the Torrita di Siena train station. The Castiglione della Pescaia beach and Cutigliano ski area are close enough for a day trip, at 90 minutes away, and the Florence airport is a convenient 75-minute drive away.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

feature.p: Additional Information Tuscany needs no introduction for those who are aware of her beauty and history. There is so much to do and see, and one can read as many books and plan to see as much as possible or simply meander from village to village and just explore. It's guaranteed that you will stumble upon exquisite scenery, architecture, artistry, heritage, and of course wonderful food and wine, undeniably, some of the best in the world.

listing.listing_description:
From its prestigious ski-in/ski-out location the Chamonix Valley, Chalet Castor enjoys instant access to the ski slopes, as well as incredible views of the Mont Blanc and Fiz mountain ranges. With four luxurious bedroom and accommodations for ten, Castor is the perfect host for an unforgettable French Alps ski vacation. Not only will you have quick and easy access to some of the best skiing on the planet, but the legendary vibrant nightlife of Chamonix is also just ten minutes from home.

Castor’s stone roof is quite the sight in the French Alps. Usually more associated with the Italian style, the stone roof makes this villa stand out, even in an area as prestigious as Chamonix. Inside, the decor is all about wood and stone, warmth and comfort, and mountain views. You’ll love the stylish updates provided by state of the art electronics and appliances. The designer furnishings make Castor even more comfortable. And, the second living room and bunk beds are perfect if you’re traveling with kids.

Chalet Castor is ideal for hosting unforgettable family dinners with its formal dining area for twelve and fully equipped kitchen, with wine fridge and breakfast bar. After dinner, gather in the living room for a movie night, while lounging next to a roaring fire. You’ll also appreciate Castor’s Wi-Fi, heated floors, satellite television, and rejuvenating steam room. During your stay, you’ll have the option between a catered and self-catered package with a variety of luxurious perks.

Just step outside of Chalet Castor’s doors, and you’ll be on your way to another exciting day of skiing on Les Houches. After your day on the mountain, head into downtown Chamonix to spend an evening exploring the vibrant city center, rich with boutique shops, restaurants and bars, and trendy nightclubs. If you’re feeling lucky, head to Casino Chamonix. If you’d rather rest up, there are several spa and wellness centres, or you could sit down for a movie at the cinema.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Sample Tuscany’s best olive oil, prosciutto, pecorino and more while surrounded by olive groves and sunflower fields at Villa Chiara. And when you’re not tasting local specialties, you can soak in the sunshine and scenery from the pool. From the villa’s perch on a hill overlooking Cortona, it’s a short drive into town or the tranquil shores of Lake Trasimeno Regional Park.

 

Drive through vineyards to reach the villa’s private grounds, which feature a swimming pool, outdoor lounging and dining areas, and a wood-fired barbecue. After days of sightseeing, cozy up indoors by the wood-burning fireplace or flip on the smart TV and Wi-Fi. Your holiday also includes daily housekeeping and concierge service, as well as a walking tour of Cortona and sessions on wine tasting and food pairings.

 

Farmhouse-inspired architectural details—think beamed ceilings and cotto floors—lend traditional charm to the open-concept living and dining room and the fully equipped kitchen at this luxury vacation rental. Reconnect with friends and family on a pair of sofas pulled up to the fireplace, or relive the day’s adventures around a dining table with seating for six.

 

Villa Chiara has one master suite with a king bed and en-suite bathroom, and 2 bedrooms with double beds that share access to a hall bathroom. All 3 bedrooms look out over Cortona. For larger parties, there’s also a sitting room with a double sofa bed to give you more flexibility.

 

The villa is a short drive from the hilltop town of Cortona, whose history stretches into the Etruscan period (and whose roots can be discovered at the Etruscan Academy Museum). Climb up to the Santa Margherita Sanctuary and Girifalco Fortress with your camera for a few great landscape shots, then reward yourself with a honeymoon-worthy plate of antipasti at a table in the sunshine.

 

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Traditional charm, classic views and modern comforts make for memorable holidays at Villa Yakamoz. Part of the exclusive Porto Rafael enclave on the northeastern coast of Sardinia, this luxury vacation rental looks out over the hillside to the azure sea. Invite up to eleven friends or family members to enjoy the rustic architectural details alongside state-of-the-art entertainment areas.

Villa Yakamoz opens to a gorgeous terrace facing the water, with daybeds and loungers scattered around an infinity pool. Covered sitting and dining areas are a respite from the sun, and a pizza oven and barbecue make it easy to try out local specialties. Inside, the villa is as well appointed as a resort, with amenities from a home theater and sauna to a games room with ping-pong and foosball tables.

Arched doorways, stone floors, brick fireplaces and vintage wooden doors give the villa’s interiors a quaint, vintage look. But the furnishings are stylish and modern, such as the roll-arm sofas and rough-hewn coffee table in the living room, and the wicker chairs around the dining table. Beamed ceilings lend homey appeal in the fully equipped kitchen, which conveniently opens to the al-fresco dining area.

Each of the five bedrooms at Villa Yakamoz has a private en-suite bathroom for your comfort. Beamed ceilings, warm neutral tones and views of the countryside make the bedrooms serene retreats where you’ll want to linger.

The villa is a short walk or drive from five different beaches where you can swim in the island’s famously clear water or take a honeymoon-worthy stroll over fine golden sand. It’s a quick trip down to the Porto Rafael marina to marvel at the yachts and oceanfront views. And the Olbia area is well worth exploring, from the gorgeous Costa Smeralda and chic resort of Porto Cervo to the historic town of Olbia itself.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Take in the beauty of golden Tuscan hillsides at sunset from this grand, traditionally-styled home. From the edge of the gleaming infinity pool, admire the surrounding olive groves and woodlands, before crossing the terrace into the stone-bedecked home. Leave the luxurious interiors to take in the local tastes and sights; from majestic Siena, to vine-wreathed wineries and family-run restaurants.

San Regolo offers an instant impression. With stone arches and mottled exterior masonry, it stands out like a home from another era on the sunlit slopes outside Casole d'Elsa. Inside, the warm tones and brick arches are maintained throughout, giving the villa a unified, old-world atmosphere. Huge, carved beds and handcrafted tables add to the provincial grandeur, while the pool, lawns and barbecue terrace help ensure guests can step out and experience the balmy outdoors at the drop of a hat.

This villa offers a great range of very local attractions, as well as those facilitated by a short drive. The medieval heritage of the town of Siena is just a short drive away, featuring a UNESCO-listed medieval piazza that is one of the region’s must-see sights. Drop by centuries-old wineries to sample delicate vernaccia, or tasting the richness of local cuisine at nearby garden bistros.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Discover the wild Maremma region of Tuscany from Villa Maremmana. Set on a large estate, this seven bedroom farmhouse has been owned by the same family for over a hundred years and was recently restored. It’s an ideal base for exploring nearby towns like Massa Marittima and Grosseto and the coast near Punta Ala.

The villa’s large estate is perfect for horseback riding or walking; don’t forget to sample produce from the vegetable garden or the olive oil, honey, wine and jams produced on the property. There’s furnished space for outdoor dining and a pool with a view of the surrounding valley; the pool house has a Turkish bath and ping-pong table. Inside the villa, you’ll find a billiards room, a study with a computer, and high-speed Internet access.

Large windows let in the Tuscan sun, and pastel walls and stone floors bounce the light around for a warm, airy feel. Gather around the central fireplace in the living room, or enjoy a cozy dinner by the light of the traditional Tuscan fireplace in the dining room. Not only is the kitchen fully equipped, but painted millwork and a marble backsplash create a charming atmosphere.

Each of Villa Maremmana’s seven bedrooms has air conditioning, and each bathroom has a towel heater. There are two bedrooms with king beds and en-suite bathrooms, one of which opens to a balcony, and two bedrooms with two twin beds and en-suite bathrooms. The fifth bedroom has a king bed and shared private bathroom, and the sixth bedroom has two twin beds and a shared private bathroom. There is also an annexe bedroom with queen size bed adn en-suite bathroom with large shower nd closet.

Though you could spend your time at Villa Maremmana simply lounging by the pool or at one of the two nearby spas, the region is well worth exploring. Hit a few balls at the tennis court that’s 5 minutes away, or saddle up at the nearby horseback riding center, which offers guided excursions. The beach is a 25 minute drive away, the harbor town of Punta Ala is 35 minutes away and it’s 17 miles to the regional center of Massa Marittima.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

feature.p: A nearby horseback riding center offers guided excursions, for experienced riders, with the possibility to ride all the way to the sea. Tennis court is 5 minutes away by car. Daily boat excursions can be arranged from the nearby harbor. The famous, bustling Punt Ala harbor is 35 minutes away by car. Two world-class spas are nearby, offering thermal baths, massage, and the most advanced aesthetic and curative treatments.
feature.strong: What to do in the Maremma region of Tuscany?
feature.p: This extraordinarily lovely stretch of Italy sits between Rome and Pisa, offering expansive, breathtaking views of the islands of Giglio and Elba. Highlights of the area include the unspoiled fishing village of Castiglione della Pescaia, endless stretches of incomparable beaches, and the medieval village of Massa Marittima. This enchanting cobble-stoned village has become greatly popular and is home to many international artists and socialites. Also worth a visit is the magical and mysterious city of Volterra, with its roots in three thousand years of history. Today the city preserves above all its medieval qualities, not only in its 12th-century city walls, but also in its urban layout with narrow streets, palaces, tower houses and churches. Strongly recommended are visits to the surrounding towns of Populonia and Baratti, Suvereto, Campiglia Marittima, Castagneto Carducci and Bolgheri.

Numerous day trip possibilities include the chic harbor of Puntala and the major art cities of Siena, Pisa and Florence. Boat rentals for cruising around the coast are available, and private tours of the region's many acclaimed wineries can be arranged.

listing.listing_description:
Enter a tranquil seaside villa with excellent facilities and diverse touches of world culture. Located on Brač’s quiet eastern shore, guests can lounge by this home’s vivid infinity pool, relax in plush, modern interiors, and slumber in comfortable bedrooms with balcony views of sailboats in the port below. The lively village of Sumartin, hidden beaches, hikes and museums are a short drive away.

A stay at Villa Mila is enriched by the scenic location, sumptuous nature of the home, and special decor touches. Palm trees reach towards the sun on the viewpoint terrace, while urban chic is evident in the hanging seats and slick exterior furniture. Asian-inspired sculptures populate the spacious bathrooms, while distinct design that recalls maritime Mediterranean culture runs through the softly-outfitted bedrooms. The smooth, concealed fixtures of the kitchen give an impression of effortless modernity, with the large, chandelier-lit dining table accommodating large groups with aplomb. 

Villa Mila is ideally located for making the most of Brač, one of the most popular islands of the Dalmatian coast. The quiet lanes and port restaurants of Sumartin village are close by, with a coast drive revealing strikingly blue water and sandy beaches. Guests can visit small wineries and roadside cafes, which offer exceptional local cheeses, olive oil and meats every few kilometres. Visit fascinating memorials, take to the gentle water with supplied kayaks, or hike through serene valleys to explore a centuries-old monastery. After an active day, a relaxing evening shooting pool or sipping a drink outdoors is ideal.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Sit back in a sun lounger beneath the shade of a palm tree while you gaze upon sweeping views of the Portopalo seascape at this modern villa in Sicily. Craft the perfectly-decorated pie in the pizza oven while the kids splash around in the pool. Then, gather for dinner at the breezy alfresco set. In the morning, drive 10 minutes to stroll along the sands of the Menfi Beaches.

The sleek and stylish architecture uses floor-to-ceiling glass to open Calypso to the beautiful breeze of the countryside. The black-and-white interior gives the villa a classic, elegant feel. Outside, palm trees, sun loungers, and dynamic views remind you the beach is close. Inside, the chef’s kitchen is sure to inspire your culinary side. At dinner, let the wood-burning fireplace add a rustic touch to an unforgettable meal.

When the sun has begun to set, unleash our inner mixologist and get creative with a few tropical cocktail recipes, or try Italy’s trademark Bellini. If you’re feeling competitive, organize a pool tournament in the billiards lounge. The losers have to jump in the pool. Later, see if you can find some soccer on the satellite television, and fire up the barbecue for some late-night snacks on the terrace.

Make sure to pack your camera if you go the Archaeological site of Selinunte 17 kilometers from home on the way to Castelvetrano. After a few pictures, wander the streets on the nearby village to find ancient architecture, quaint cafes, and bustling patio restaurants. A little closer to home, you’ll find fantastic cycling routes, World-class vineyards and wineries, and white sand beaches in Menfi.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Please note: This home is in close proximity to an ongoing construction project. For more information, please contact a Villa Specialist. 

Gaze out on panoramic vistas of the Saronic Gulf from this majestic, 4-story home at Anavyssos along the Athens Riviera. Perched directly above Paralia Agios Nikolaos Beach, the contemporary villa (built in 2015) offers superb amenities for spa-style relaxation and gourmet festivities, including an indoor hot tub, outdoor pool, and top-of-the-line kitchen. Drive about 25 kilometers to Cape Sounion or 43 kilometers north into the heart of Athens.

Multiple terraces and balconies inspire long days and nights in the Aegean breeze. Plunge into the swimming pool (up to 2.7 meters in depth) and bask in the Grecian sun on stylish lounge chairs. Relish a meze platter at the alfresco table, and uncork a bottle of local wine. Kindle the grill at sunset for a barbecue feast of fresh seafood. At night, dip into the pool again for a hydromassage amid the multicolored lighting.

The villa’s interiors feature multiple living and dining areas too, with ample room for private downtime or festive gatherings. Try your hand at Greek cuisine in the fully equipped kitchen, and gather for intimate dinners at the table for 6; then cap off the night with a glass of ouzo by the fire. Modern conveniences including an elevator, Wi-Fi, 55-inch TVs, heating, and air conditioning ensure a comfortable stay for all travelers. 

With 4 deluxe bedrooms suites, Villa Nelmar is ideal for destination wedding guests, family reunions, business retreats, or groups of friends up to 8 in size. Each room includes a king bed and ensuite bathroom, and 2 of the rooms enjoy private balconies with sensational views.

The villa enjoys a prime location between Sounion and Athens, surrounded by the myriad treasures of the southern Attic coastline. Alykes is just one of many beaches between here and the famous Temple of Poseidon, the Greek sea god whose worshippers were obviously fond of soul-stirring sunsets. Drive about 40 kilometers north to explore the Acropolis and roam the streets of Plaka and downtown Athens.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
This beautiful modern 6-bedroom villa sits on wooded hill some 2 kilometres from Sorrento and enjoys panoramic views over the Gulf of Sorrento with the impressive Vesuvio and Bay of Naples. The villa is beautifully appointed and the owners have added every modern convenience and luxury furnishing to make this a superb holiday property.

Outdoor: The villa is surrounded by a 2500 sq. m. garden with many relaxing spots. All the flowering garden is full of plants and, above all, of typical lemon and olive trees. The villa has 2 stunning terraces equipped by lounge and sofa. A newest pool has just set in the garden to fully enjoys this wonderful retreat.

The spacious gardens also have a dining area, tables, chairs and a barbeque and views over the Mediterranean. In the garden there is also a private parking for up to 2 cars. This is a very high-quality property in a much sought-after area of the Sorrento coast.

Villa Sorrento’s coveted setting is within easy reach by car of Sorrento’s great shopping, “trattorie and pavement cafés” and port for hydrofoil to Capri and Naples. Chic, well planned and very contemporary, this luxury villa in Campania enjoys an elevated spot in an exclusive area of Sorrento, boasting fantastic views of the town and its famously scenic bay.

The volcanic earth gives incredible flavour to local produce and within easy reach are some of the best restaurants in the area Don Alfonso 1890 in Sant'Agata in Lo Scoglio at Marina del Cantone which can be booked by the YPI Representative.

High standards of service can be complemented with the assistance of our local Representative for private excursions, cooking lessons or motorboat cruising in the bay. Chef service, not included, could add an extra level of leisurely idleness. This is also sensational walking country with scented trails threading up through the hills to panoramic viewpoints. Highly recommended.

listing.listing_description:
Set on a hilltop in the countryside just south of Siena, Villa Ferraia offers luxury accommodations for groups of up to 27 people. There’s something for everyone to do, from cooking lessons and stargazing to gardening and spa experiences in the pools and sauna. A library, nearby trails and fourteen bedrooms arranged in three areas create a peaceful, private retreat in an idyllic setting.

The villa has plenty to offer both adventurous travelers and guests who’d prefer to relax. Take a walk through the woods just outside, arrange a cooking lesson or join a stargazing session with a local astronomy society. Ask the gardener about helping in the vegetable garden, then grill the produce on the barbecue. If you’d rather relax while on holiday, this expansive vacation rental has a library, home theater and plenty of seating on the covered terrace with glorious views over the hills of Tuscany. An outdoor pool, three plunge pools and a Finnish-style sauna create your very own mini-spa area.

Inside, Villa Ferraia is warm and eclectic, with white slipcovered sofas gathered around brightly painted fireplaces, traditionally inspired wooden tables and rustic brick archways. There are plenty of tucked-away seating areas for a quiet moment spent reading or napping, but the formal dining room can seat all 27 friends or family members at once. The villa has a fully equipped kitchen, and continental breakfast is included in your stay. On-request meals can be provided at extra cost if you’d like something special to celebrate a birthday, anniversary or just being together.

The villa’s fourteen bedrooms are divided into three areas: the main house, a guest house and a guest suite. The main house has ten bedrooms, most with en-suite bathrooms, that share two common living rooms. The guest house has its own entrance and three bedrooms with en-suite bathrooms that share a living room and kitchenette. The guest suite also has its own entrance from the courtyard, and with its en-suite bathroom, living and dining areas, it could double as a honeymoon or in-law suite.

It’s well worth taking time to explore the area around Villa Ferraia. The estate is a 15-minute drive from the charming town of Monticiano, which has restaurants, shops and a tennis court. In the winter, head for the ski slopes of Monte Amiata, an hour’s drive away, or for an indulgent soak in the hot springs at Terme di Petriolo. If you’re visiting during the summer, plan to play a round or two at the Bagnaia or Punta Ala golf courses, or spend a languid afternoon on the Castiglione della Pescaia beach, a 97 km drive from the property. When it’s time to leave, plan on a 143 km drive to Pisa or a 40-minute private flight to Rome from the nearby airport of Ampugnano.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Tenuta Pomona is located on the southern hillside of the ancient Etruscan town, Cortona. This recently renovated stone villa and cottage have been updated to meet the highest standard of luxury travel. Tenuta Pomona’s designers focused on maintaining the villa’s architectural authenticity, using materials of great value that honor the morphology of Tuscany’s unique landscape. With four luxurious bedrooms, spacious interiors, and large, secluded property, this villa is perfect for a family getaway, high-end corporate retreat, or special occasion.

Positioned a comfortable distance from the lights and sounds of Cortona, Tenuta Pomona’s beautiful estate is decorated with lush lawns, vibrant gardens, and iconic olive trees. Both the Main House and Guest House are made from ancient stone, with exposed wood beams and tiled floors to complete the authentic Tuscan atmosphere. The villa’s interior decor is stately and elegant, with contemporary designer furnishings, warm wood accents, and shuttered-windows to capture views of the countryside. The fully equipped kitchen has its foot furthest into the future, with state of the art appliances and updated granite countertops. You’ll also appreciate satellite television, Wi-Fi, air conditioning, and the grand fireplace in the living room.

If you’re planning a special occasion or just casual family dinners, Tenuta Pomona has formal dining inside with seating for eight, alfresco dining for ten, and several smaller lounge areas that are perfect for morning coffees. During your stay, you’ll enjoy daily housekeeping, daily breakfast, and welcome dinner with a private chef.

Another perk included with your reservation is a walking tour of Cortana, which is a great way to get acquainted with the area and all of its history, as well as its boutique shops, bakeries, markets, and nightlife establishments. If you’re up for a day trip, the bustling city of Siena is less than an hour from home, or, you could do the opposite and head to Trasimeno Regional Park and immerse yourself in the beautiful natural environment of Italy.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
The Lodge is set in the beautiful rolling countryside of Andalusia’s Serrania de Ronda Mountains and is surrounded by national parks and the famous white villages. It’s an ideal get away with a modern contemporary feel, that successfully combines the feeling of a luxury hotel with the exclusivity of your own private space. Professional staff unobtrusively tends to your every need. It’s just a short drive away from the beautiful historic town of Ronda and is a perfect base to enjoy wonderful Andalusia.

The Lodge offers extensive facilities for those who want to unwind but still keep fit and healthy and enjoy their regular exercise regime. Built on a private 22 acre property which includes both walking and jogging trails, horses tranquilly graze the attractive grounds. In the villa a large mirrored room allows you to enjoy Pilates, yoga, weight training or watching training program DVDs. Why not take advantage of the massage room that is just next door and the full menu of spa services available?

The drawing room features comfortable sofas in front of a large open fire, the perfect place for relaxing and inspiring good conversation. The décor includes original artwork from Tangier to Rwanda. Your pool area provides more opportunities to unwind and ionizers in the water ensure that the water is like drinking quality and extremely gentle on your eyes, hair and skin. For the majority of the year you can expect meals to include vegetables and herbs from The Lodge’s own organic gardens. You’ll also enjoy fish caught fresh from the Andalusian coast, and excellent quality meat provided by local organic suppliers. In fact, special care is taken in all food preparation at The Lodge and includes some innovative and delicious vegetarian dishes. You can select from a variety of meal options when you choose to dine in.

The Lodge has seven luxuriously appointed bedrooms, all with en-suite facilities and breathtaking views of the surrounding majestic countryside and grounds. The perfect place to wake up and enjoy Andalusia.

The Lodge Ronda is also a truly romantic setting for your wedding. A unique combination of Andalusia meets Africa, the inspiration for The Lodge comes from the owners’ love of South Africa. They created a beautiful marriage of the two cultures resulting in a very special place! Lush green and tropical gardens blend naturally into the surrounding olive groves and rolling hills forming a romantic backdrop for your wedding day. The Lodge is Ronda’s most exclusive wedding venue can accommodate up to 125 guests. 

The Lodge is truly one of the most beautiful Andalusian rural accommodations, with Sevilla, Córdoba, Malaga, Jerez and Granada right on your doorstep. Historic Ronda with its restaurants is just 9.4 km away and it’s just a 40 km drive to Los Arceos Golf Course, 50 km to the beach and 94 km to Malaga and the Airport.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Situated amongst olive trees in the rollings hills between Florence and Siena, Villa Le Scuderie is the perfect getaway on the Chianti countryside. Located in Greve, this newly renovated farmhouse offers incredible views of olive groves and vineyards that stretch as far as the eye can see. From Greve, you’ll be able to plan day trips to some of Italy’s most exciting art cities, ancient hamlets, and an endless list of local vineyards, restaurants, and natural wonders. With four queen en-suites and a beautifully spacious estate, Villa Le Scuderie is perfect for a family getaway, vacation with friends, or a high-end corporate retreat.

Merging the Old-World with the new, Villa Le Scuderie shows off its ancient authenticity on the exterior with original stone walls and tiled roof, while inside, you’ll surely appreciate the updated, contemporary atmosphere, decorated with high-end electronics and designer furnishings. This villa’s unique floor plan is a testament to the owner's desire not to disturb the original structure. Architectural ingenuity has an indoor swimming pool overlooking the kitchen and dining area, proving that, sometimes, you can have it all. The kitchen, dining room, and lounge area flow seamlessly out to the terrace, where you’ll find even more dining space and amazing views of the Chianti countryside.

At Villa Le Scuderie, the indoor swimming pool isn’t the only place to relax and enjoy the view; there’s also a hot tub on the terrace. Back inside, you’ll appreciate television, air conditioning, and a fireplace, as well as daily housekeeping and continental breakfasts for the duration of your stay.

In less than an hour’s drive, you’ll find Michelangelo’s “David,” Botticelli’s “The Birth of Venus,” and da Vinci’s “Annunciation” in the many galleries and museums of Florence. Head in the opposite direction, and you can visit Siena’s Piazza Del Campo, Torre Del Mangia, and the Siena Cathedral. If you’d like to stick a little closer to home, you’ll find incredible pizza at Piazza Matteotti and classic Chanti cuisine at Osteria Al Ponte, both in Greve. And, Discover Tuscany offers several options for guided wine tours, many of which come with private drivers.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Lose yourself in 100-acres of woodlands, olive groves, and vegetable gardens on this 15-Century estate in Pieve di Compito, Italy. Explore fairytale-like settings decorated with palm and cypress trees, lush lawns, and endless countryside views. Embrace state of the art luxuries carefully integrated into an ancient farmhouse setting. Then, drive to Lucca for an authentic Tuscan dinner.

With its 15th-Century-bones intact, Villa Carista’s pastel stucco walls, tiled-roof, and exposed-beam ceiling burst with authenticity. On a quiet afternoon, pick a good book from the library and do a little reading beneath the shaded pergola. Pamper yourself in the spa-inspired ensuite’s jetted tub. Or challenge a friend to a game of pool in the billiards room.

If you’re celebrating a special occasion, Carista has everything you’ll need to host an unforgettable event. Outside, there’s parking for 10 vehicles, an alfresco dining set, and a barbeque. Inside, the fully-equipped kitchen has everything you’ll need to try your hand at traditional Tuscan cuisine. After dinner, move the party outside to the poolside lounge.

Often overlooked for the more popular tourist destinations, Florence and Pisa, Lucca is a beautiful medieval city packed with cafes, bakeries, bars, and historical sites. Rent a bicycle and check out the Cathedral of St. Martin, where most of Lucca’s most important pieces of art are on display. Then, head to Piazza dell’Anfiteatro, the bustling town square lined with patio restaurants and bars.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Villa Lorenzo is a deluxe villa located between Santa Getrudis and San Lorenzo in the stylish Ibiza area of Spain. This luxury villa is a comfortable and refined choice for those who want the peace and tranquility of the Spanish countryside combined with the option of fabulous activities nearby. The house is set on two acres of land, with beautiful pastoral views of the Church of Santa Eularia and the ocean beyond.

The backyard of the house features a huge rectangular swimming pool surrounded by oversized daybeds, loungers and various areas to chill out, in the sun or the shade. There’s even an outdoor kitchen with a gas barbecue, sink and fridge. The villa has a luxurious feel and works well for families, couples or groups. Whether you want a massage on one of the many terraces, to laze in the Bali house while keeping an eye on the children in the magical play area or watch a movie from the extensive library, this villa provides all the perks for a wonderful holiday in Santa Eularia des Riu. At your request, the owners of Villa Lorenzo can even leave their dog, Bonny, to keep guests company—always a big hit with families. Housekeeping and security are included with your reservation.

Villa Lorenzo offers a balance of comfort and style with the feeling of a boutique hotel. The architecture and style of the house is fresh and welcoming. The villa has been completely renovated in a style that fuses the contemporary with touches of the Mediterranean and Asia. Many of the furnishings and woodwork have been imported from Bali, with the overall airy and sophisticated feeling in the house. The open plan living, dining and kitchen area opens out onto the gardens and pool area.

Five delectable bedrooms accommodate up to eleven guests at Villa Lorenzo. All of the bedrooms include en-suite bathrooms, iPod docks, air conditioning, double or king beds and access either a terrace or a balcony; the master bedroom has sea views as well. An extra room (not air-conditioned) with a single bed off the master bedroom is a perfect spot for kids to sleep.  From hanging chairs to a whimsical sea-themed mural in the children’s room, there is something for everyone.

At Villa Lorenzo, you will be surrounded by farmland in complete privacy (including an orchard where you can pick your own fruit), but you will also be just minutes from Santa Gertrudis and San Lorenzo with their shops and restaurants. This villa is also a short drive from the Santa Eularia and Ibiza Town. Close to the beach and the fun of Ibiza—a splendid Spanish holiday awaits!

Copyright © 2015 Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
This ultra-modern villa is nestled close to the legendary core of one of Europe’s most renowned historical cities; Florence. Drink in a sunset view of the city’s spires from the alfresco dining area, as candles glow and smouldering fire pits light the garden. After a day’s sightseeing, stroll in the herb garden or sip Tuscan wine on the rooftop terrace as stars peek out of the velvety dusk.   

Dimora Bellosguardo was designed with straight lines and open spaces being prioritized, but with the very best in deep-comfort furnishings and modern technology included as standard. Guests will awake in spacious bedrooms, and can swing massive sun doors to gain direct and easy access to the fragrances of the flower-filled garden. A fully-equipped kitchen is mirrored by a long living room, complete with plush sofa and top-of-the-line TV and sound system. Extras like the rooftop hot tub and charcoal barbecue means guests can relax and socialize with ease, with all the architectural grandeur of this, the birthplace of the Renaissance, in clear view. 

The villa’s location is one of the major positives. Located just a 15 minute walk from the Basilica di Santo Spirito, the villa offers great access to the beating heart of Florence, with wonders like the Florence Cathedral and the Ponte Vecchio bridge being must-sees. The wider culinary and cultural delights of Tuscany are also there for the taking, with the villa’s location to the south of Florence making a quick escape to the olive groves, hilltop villages and roadside restaurants of Tuscany all too easy. The great square of Sienna and the famous castles and towers of Pisa are great day-trip options located just a little further afield. 

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Creamy stone turns warm and inviting in the Puglia sunshine bathing this lovingly restored masseria. Surrounded by centuries-old olive groves, this farmhouse still has the remnants of presses built into rock walls, but modern furnishings breathe new life into its traditional vaulted-ceiling rooms. It’s a short drive to Ostuni, a hilltop town known as the White City for its pearl-like buildings.

Stone walls and tall hedges make the villa’s grounds quiet and private. Catch up on reading in a lounger in the sun, cool off in the swimming pool, sit down for aperitivo beneath the pergola, and pick up market-fresh produce to toss on the barbecue and serve at the alfresco table for 8. While the home’s ancient mill dates back centuries, it also has state-of-the-art technology such as an integrated sound system and Wi-Fi.

Step through French doors from the terrace into the long open-concept great room at this vacation rental, whose stone floors and arched ceilings come to life in the sunshine. There’s a sitting area with a generous sectional, a dining table for 6, and a fully equipped kitchen with colorful tile and an inviting breakfast table.

This luxury property has 3 bedrooms with double beds, including a master suite with its own balcony, and 1 bedroom with a queen bed. All 4 bedrooms have ensuite bathrooms and air conditioning to keep you comfortable during summer in Italy.

The town nearest the villa is Ostuni, a hilltop enclave whose architecture dates back to medieval times. Stroll its maze-like streets, pausing to sample local olive oil—or gelato, if you’re on holiday with the whole family—have a glass of wine, or sit down to a honeymoon-worthy dinner featuring seafood from the nearby coast. For a memorable day trip, see the sea in Polignano a Mare or explore the Grotte di Castellana caves.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Reconstructed in traditional Tuscan style, this farmhouse captures the scenic forest and valley views of Casali di Casole. Follow stone walkways connected each living space on this vast property, stopping every-now-and-again to spot a deer or pheasant. Inside, imposing architecture invites unmatched authenticity to your dinner parties. Or, dine at the estate's restaurant, just across the meadow.

San Damiano's kitchen is sure to inspire your inner chef with its top-notch appliances, spacious layout, and vibrant backsplash. When the others come to see what you're up to, give them a sneak peek to enjoy at the bistro-set on the balcony. When you're ready, dine under the chandeliers in the formal setting. But first, pick the perfect pairing from the wine cellar.

After dinner, let the party spill out to the terrace. Gather at the alfresco set for dessert and a cocktail or 2. When things heat up, turn it into a pool party or embrace San Damiano's relaxing side and move to the hot tub. If you're craving a late-night snack, pizza from the wood-fired oven is always a delicious bet. Then, retire to the master's spa-like ensuite and 4-post bed.

Once you've explored the hiking, biking, and horseback trails of the Casali Estate, venture on to Siena and check out the view from Torre del Mangia, the cities highest lookout. Then, make your way to the Uffizi Gallery in Florence to see the works of Giotto, Michelangelo, and Botticelli, to name a few. And, compare your work to that of Mangia Pizza Firenze, one of Florence's best traditional pizza restaurants.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Glimpse the Tuscany of the past in the pastoral surroundings and graceful 19th-century architecture of Villa Controni. Formerly the summer residence of the Contronis, a noble merchant family, this well-preserved vacation rental now welcomes parties of up to twenty-two guests to its tranquil setting outside Lucca. Though the villa was once a working estate, today it’s the perfect place to host a family reunion or even an intimate Italian wedding with pine forests and castle-dotted hilltops as a backdrop.

Your holiday at Villa Controni includes chef service at breakfast and lunch or dinner. Spend your stay taking in the views across the olive groves to the Nottolini aqueduct, breathing in the scent of the flowers in the walled garden, stretching out on a lounger by the pool or trying out local specialties from the barbecue at the al-fresco dining area. Inside, amenities like a fitness center, games room and wine fridge make it easy to relax or entertain. The property even has a private chapel that can be used for weddings.

The interiors of this luxury property revel in its Old World heritage, from the glittering chandeliers and plush area rugs to the brightly painted paneling that lines the sitting and dining rooms. A quiet study shows the same elegance on a smaller scale, while the fully equipped kitchen is large enough to cater for a crowd. Despite the villa’s history, it has modern features from Wi-Fi and air conditioning to satellite television as well.

Each of the villa’s eleven sumptuous bedrooms has an en-suite bathroom; ten of them have double beds and one offers the choice of a queen bed or two twin beds. You’ll be enchanted both by the suites’ stone floors and traditional furnishings, and the sweeping views of the countryside out the windows.

Villa Controni is less than 5 miles from Lucca and a tennis club, and less than 20 miles from Pisa and a golf course. Spend a day in Lucca for to admire its palazzos and churches and look out from the famous tree-topped Guinigi Tower, or drive into Pisa for a photo op and a romantic, honeymoon-style stroll along the river where luminaries from Galileo to Fibonacci have walked.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Set between two beautiful avenues lined with majestic trees, La Réserve de Paris stands out in this iconic city with its domed slate roof. Enjoy that certain je ne sais quoi about returning home each day to this timeless area of the world. This Parisian Hideaway faces the Place du Trocadero with the many terraces of its old-time brasseries. Experience the romance of the City of Light in an authentic vacation rental with Luxury Retreats!

This chic and intimate accommodation is located in a splendid Haussmann-style, cut-stone building. In the ideal setting for a discreet, private getaway to stylish Trocadero, even the housekeeper will be virtually invisible while serving each morning’s personalized breakfast. Guests of Mon Eiffel will receive complimentary access to all the hotel services of La Réserve de Paris, a five-star hotel and spa that will make daily life even more magical. Facilities include a swimming pool, fitness center, steam room and library.

This beautiful and spacious apartment features well-delineated day and night areas, which means that children can sleep peacefully while parents are hosting friends in the vast formal dining room. The remarkably sized windows ensure the living room is flooded with light that illuminates the modern works of art. With stunning classic architecture, the contemporary interior design creates a magnificent contrast that embodies the new Parisian chic.

Two bedrooms accommodate up to four guests at this non-smoking apartment. Both bedrooms provide queen size beds, en-suite bathrooms and televisions. One of the suites also has a rain shower and a balneotherapy tub. Fine linens and accoutrements provide splendid nights of rest amid the hushed frequencies of the city. We recommend Mon Eiffel for a family getaway, a couples’ retreat or a decadent honeymoon in this unrivaled cultural destination.

Guests of Mon Eiffel will enjoy the services of a full, professional staff. Daily housekeeping, butler service, daily breakfasts, a welcome package, daily afternoon tea times, laundry service and valet service are all included with your holiday reservation. Sportive guests will also love use of the bicycles and complimentary access to the Roland Garros Tennis Courts, home of the French Open. Paris never looked so good!

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
The hot colors of Warhol’s Marilyns pop against the cool blue of the sea at this modern retreat near Trogir and Split. Pop-art works throughout the house play on comic strips and classic films, while a pool, alfresco lounging area, and optional extras like a motorboat and jet skis are meant for playing outside. There are sea views aplenty from the villa and it’s a 3-minute walk to the beach.

Make the most of the villa’s south-facing hillside location in outdoor living areas with a heated infinity pool, barbecue, loungers, rowing machine, and a dining table for 8. As the light fades on the white faces of the homes on the neighboring island of Solta, step inside to turn on the satellite TV, LCD projector, and Sonos sound system, or share photos of your holiday over Wi-Fi.

This luxury property is classic Croatia: red-roofed homes spilling over the hills outside, and sleek contemporary architecture inside. It’s all centered on an open-concept great room with nearly wall-to-wall glass, where the sitting area, dining area, and fully equipped kitchen all boast sea views.

There are 2 bedrooms with king beds at this vacation rental and 2 bedrooms with 2 twin beds each; all 4 have private ensuite bathrooms, and 3 of the 4 open to a balcony or terrace. Each one is a honeymoon-worthy hideaway with colorful bedding, large-scale artwork, and Instagram-friendly details like a neon sign or sea views.

The villa is a 3-minute walk from the nearest beach and a short drive from 2 other beaches, including the stretch known as Copacabana for its white shores, turquoise water, and array of restaurants and bars. The Okrug Gornji location is also a 13-minute drive to the medieval walls of old-town Trogir, where you can explore as a family or catch up over drinks as a couple.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Isimora is a superb villa located about twenty-five minutes by car from the heart of Florence. The two-story home is set within a beautiful park on a large private estate, allowing you to savor the open air of Tuscany in total privacy, while exquisitely restored interiors offer vintage rustic charm and contemporary comforts. The vacation rental includes the services of a butler, maid, and cook, and its six ample bedrooms accommodate up to twelve guests.

The villa's exterior summons the country estates of old, with luminous white facades, rich green shutters, and superb wooden doors framed in stone. A swimming pool invites you to a refreshing plunge on summer days, while comfortable lounge furniture welcomes relaxing hours in the fragrant air. Relish alfresco meals and toast each other with a fine local wine on the terrace in the evening.

Indoors, fresh white wall finishes accentuate the beautiful terracotta tile and natural wood ceilings. Plentiful windows infuse the home with ample daylight, while lovely candelabra and wall sconces cast an enchanting luminosity by night. The salon features a large, rustic fireplace and comfortable furnishings, while the dining room seats twelve at a gorgeous table beside Baroque-era pictures. The kitchen is simple yet fully equipped with chef-ready appliances. Heating and air condoning will keep you comfortable regardless of the season.

The villa's master suite features a king bed and ensuite bathroom with shower and tub, while the adjoining den includes rose-colored furnishings beside a fireplace. All five guestroom have queen beds and private bathrooms, four of them ensuite. There is air conditioning in every bedroom.

Isimora provides superb balance of bucolic tranquility and convenient access to the riches of Tuscany and Florence. The city's center is a short drive or train ride from your door, while Siena and Arezzo are also within easy reach. Farther afield, Lucca and Pisa are excellent daytrip destinations. Golf-lovers are just twenty-four kilometers from Ugolino.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Quiet settles over tree-lined streets and the topiaries in the private back garden at this intimate greater London apartment. The walled lawn and trellised balcony feel like a piece of the English countryside, while rooms filled with rich colors and soft textures are a retreat from the city. Yet it’s within walking distance to shopping and dining, and less than 10 minutes to the nearest Tube.

Reward yourself for a day out and about with a cocktail and dinner from the barbecue in the garden at the alfresco table for 6. Watch the stars come out there, or look to the smart TV, surround-sound system, and Wi-Fi for entertainment. There are laundry facilities for your convenience, and both air conditioning and heating to keep you comfortable no matter how warm or chilly the weather in England.

Sunshine from the terrace and buttery-toned walls lend a warm ambience to the L-shaped living and dining room inside this vacation rental, while espresso-hued accents and artwork in deep burgundy and chocolate add depth. The separate kitchen is fully equipped, down to a Nespresso machine.

A single bedroom with a king bed and ensuite bathroom makes this villa ideal for a couple on a city break or looking to relive their honeymoon. Polished wood and black leather panels alternate for a sumptuous feel in the bedroom, helped by the brilliant red of the duvet.

This luxury property is in the heart of Maida Vale, where you’ll spot tourists posing like the Beatles on the famous zebra crossing and creative types tending the gardens outside their family homes. Shop and dine in the neighborhood and, if you’d like to see more of the city on your holiday, it’s less than a 10-minute drive to Hyde Park and Kensington Palace, and less than 3 miles to Harrods and Buckingham Palace.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Faded wooden walkways lead the way through a manicured yard and towering trees to this modern home. Completely renovated in 2015, plush, velvet-finished furniture and a caramel colour scheme add a comfortable, homey element to the space. Located on the south-west side of Ibiza, you’re only a 10-minute drive from the excitement of restaurants, beach clubs, and of course, a vibrant nightlife. 

Wide entryways let each room flow into the next, creating fluidity throughout. A focal point, besides the natural stone walls, is the floating staircase that winds its way up to the second floor. Woven pendant lights add rustic charm to the alfresco dining area for 12. Glass walls and windows let natural light stream in from dawn to dusk. Take a seat on the vine-covered upstairs terrace to get the best view of the dramatic sunsets.

Ideal for a family holiday, the tree-lined Can Bella property features fun for everyone; take your best serve on the flood-lit tennis court, play a game of pétanque, or cool off in the unheated, circular swimming pool. The many sunbeds and loungers under the grass-roofed pergola provide refuge from the sun. In nearby Sant Josep de sa Talaia, jeep tours, parasailing adventures and snorkeling await. Pack up the car and explore the electric turquoise waters at Cala Tarida. As a special treat, at-home couple’s massages are available.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
At the end of a long, winding, and forested road stemming from the village of Mensano, you’ll find this authentic Tuscan farmhouse nestled in peaceful solitude. Capture sweeping hillside-views, valleys of wildflowers, and lush forest from the living room’s glazed-over archway. When you’re ready to explore, visit Montalcino and pick up a bottle or 2 from the world-famous Brunello Vineyard.

From the imposing stone archway window to an impressive chef’s kitchen, La Fonte’s great room has everything you could hope for in a social setting. Gather the group at the kitchen’s farm-style island to discuss dinner plans. Then, dine beneath the lights hung from the exposed-wood ceiling. After, sip cocktails in the fireplace lounge before retiring to the masters 4-post bed and spa-like ensuite.

The small sitting area by the main window is the perfect spot to catch up on some reading while watching the kids splash around in the pool below. If you’re keeping up with daily life, Smart TV, Wi-Fi, and office space will help. If not, melt any lingering stress away in the hot tub or enjoy an afternoon nap in a sun lounger. Daily housekeeping will keep the villa feeling fresh, and the concierge service is always there to lend a hand.

Plan yourself a full day in Florence, Tuscany’s capital, to learn the history, see the sights, and taste everything. Start by snapping a few pics of “David,” Michelangelo’s famous sculpture at Galleria del Accademia. Then, visit Brunelleschi’s Duomo, Giotto’s bell tower, and the incredible collection of art at Uffizi Gallery. For dinner, visit the bustling patio at Nobile Bistro in Piazza Di Madonna Degli Aldobrandini.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Enjoy both traditional Provençal charm and the comfort of a newly renovated villa at Maison Noves. Though its stone walls and tiled roof speak to the history of the Avignon area, this luxury property boasts modern amenities from a home theater and pool to full air conditioning. Invite up to fourteen friends and family members to join you at this seven-bedroom vacation rental in the heart of Provence.

Your holiday at Maison Noves begins with a welcome package of local fruit and wine, and continues with lazy afternoons by the saltwater pool, loungers and pétanque court, followed by evenings of dinners from the barbecue at the al-fresco dining table for sixteen. After sunset, unwind inside in the home theater, play a game or two on the pool table or share photos via Wi-Fi.

While architectural details such as stone walls, beamed ceilings and arched windows lend traditional charm, the interiors of Maison Noves have been completely updated. At their center is an open-concept dining area and fully equipped kitchen with a breakfast bar and state-of-the-art appliances. Several sitting areas invite you to stretch out to watch TV or catch up on reading.

The villa has three bedrooms with double beds and two bedrooms with queen beds, all with private en-suite bathrooms, as well as two bedrooms with two twin beds each that have access to a shared bathroom. Like the main living areas, the bedrooms are an appealing mix of the traditional and modern, with stone walls next to contemporary furnishings.

While this tucked-away property feels like your own country estate, it’s less than 30 minutes by car to some of the highlights of Provence, including Avignon, St. Remy de Provence and Luberon. Be sure to take time to explore the area, whether it’s browsing the local farmers’ markets, visiting sights like historic churches and palaces, or sitting down to a honeymoon-worthy dinner of regional specialties. For shopping and dining, the nearest spot is the pretty town of Noves.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.
